message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Zaleplon is a sedative-hypnotic medication used to treat insomnia and has a short half-life, which reduces the likelihood of daytime drowsiness compared to other medications. Temazepam and Diphenhydramine are also sedative-hypnotics but have longer half-lives, while Suvorexant is a newer medication and its effects on daytime drowsiness are not as well studied.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Zaleplon is a short-acting hypnotic drug that does not cause drowsiness during the day. Temazepam and Diphenhydramine may cause drowsiness during the day, and Suvorexant is a new drug that is associated with daytime sleepiness and cataplexy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient does not want a drug that makes him drowsy during the day, which rules out Temazepam and Diphenhydramine. Suvorexant is a new medication and may not be appropriate for a short-term trial. Zaleplon is a short-acting medication that can help with sleep onset without causing daytime drowsiness, making it the most appropriate option for this patient.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Zaleplon is a non-benzodiazepine hypnotic agent that has a short half-life and is therefore less likely to cause drowsiness during the day compared to other options like Temazepam and Diphenhydramine. Suvorexant is also an option but may cause drowsiness and has a longer half-life.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Zaleplon has a short half-life and it is less likely to cause drowsiness during the day compared to Temazepam and Diphenhydramine. Suvorexant is a newer medication used for insomnia but it may cause drowsiness during the day.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Zaleplon is a non-benzodiazepine hypnotic drug that has a short half-life and a low risk of causing daytime drowsiness. It is used for short-term treatment of insomnia in patients who have difficulty falling asleep but not maintaining sleep. Temazepam and Diphenhydramine are both sedative drugs that can cause daytime drowsiness. Suvorexant is a newer insomnia medication that works by blocking the action of orexin, a neurotransmitter that promotes wakefulness, but its safety profile is not well-established.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Zaleplon is a short-acting hypnotic that does not cause daytime drowsiness and is suitable for short-term use. Temazepam and Diphenhydramine can cause daytime drowsiness and are not suitable. Suvorexant is a newer medication with a different mechanism of action, but its safety and effectiveness are not well established in older adults.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Zaleplon has a short half-life and is less likely to cause daytime drowsiness compared to other options. Temazepam and Diphenhydramine can cause residual daytime sedation and Suvorexant can cause next-day drowsiness.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Zaleplon is a non-benzodiazepine hypnotic agent that is rapidly absorbed and short-acting, allowing the patient to fall asleep quickly without feeling drowsy the next day. Temazepam and Diphenhydramine are both sedative medications that can cause drowsiness during the day. Suvorexant is a newer drug that works by blocking orexin, a chemical in the brain that regulates wakefulness, but it has a longer half-life and may cause some daytime sleepiness.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient wants a drug that does not make him drowsy during the day, which rules out Temazepam and Diphenhydramine. Suvorexant is a new drug and the patient is older, which puts him at a higher risk for side effects. Zaleplon is a short-acting drug that improves sleep onset without affecting the sleep architecture or causing residual daytime somnolence, making it the most appropriate option for this patient.
